text: The Trident School, located south of Trident, Montana, was built in 1911. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1981. It is a one- story woodframe building which was started as a one-room schoolhouse in 1911 and expanded in 1914. It was built to serve the company town of the Trident Cement Company, and, relatedly, has a stucco exterior. With ==References== Category:Schools in Montana Category:One-room schoolhouses Category:National Register of Historic Places in Gallatin County, Montana Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1911
title: Trident School
